1917 "Artik" was buildt in Balsfjord for Hans Olsen, Meyer Olsen and Lorentrs Olsen. She was transferred to Th. Øien P/R Tromsø.
(Ref.: Magnus Sefland: Register of Norwegian Sealers / Norges Handelsflåte 1923 / Byfogden i Tromsø, Skipsregister)

1919: "Artik" was sold to Hagbart Kræmer, Kristian Olsen and Th. Øyen. They owned 1/3 each. They owned "Arktik" till she was wrecked in 1928.
(Ref.: Byfogden i Tromsø, Skipsregister.)

1920: Fishing register T 13 T.
(Ref.: Norske skipsforlis i 1928.)

1922: The owner of "Arktik": Hagbart Kræmer, Kristian Olsen and Th. Øien. Capt. Kr. Olsen. The "Artik" was arrested by the Russian, but later retured to Tromsø,  loaded with pelts and blubber.
(Ref.: Byfogden i Tromsø, Skipsregister / Nils A. Yreberg: "Tromsø Bys Historie III"

1928: 15 Norwegian sealers were lost whilst sealing in 1928. Thes were "Artik", "Sleipner", "Johan", "Drivis" and "Heimen" of Tromsø, "Aurora" and "Onward" of Vardø, "Brandalingen", "Remø", "Polarhavet" and "Haugar" of Ålesund, "Storsælen" of Bodø, "Tovik" and "Kvitbjørn" of Harstad and "Tordenskjold" of Balsfjord". The previous year (1927) seven Norwegian sealers were lost whilst sealing.
"Artik" was wrecked in the White Sea whilst sealing on 24th April 1928. The crew taken up by the "Polartind".
(Ref.: Norske skipsforlis i 1928 / Norske skipsforlis i 1927 / Byfogden i Tromsø, Skipsregister / Magnus Seflands Register of Norwegian sealers, Norsk Polarinstitutt).
